title: ‚ÄúNobody believed in us!‚Äù - Augsburg ecstatic after shock Bayern win
description: FC Augsburg‚Äôs players and their coach were still soaking in the disbelief and joy following their stunning 2‚Äë1 win over Bayern Munich.Robin Fellhauer summed up the mood: ‚ÄúWe had to believe in ou...
fullText:
FC Augsburg‚Äôs players and their coach were still soaking in the disbelief and joy following their stunning 2‚Äë1 win over Bayern Munich.

Robin Fellhauer summed up the mood: ‚ÄúWe had to believe in ourselves. Nobody believed in us, so we had to do it ourselves. We wanted to play well, force a bit of luck, and then make the most of it. We can hardly believe it - it‚Äôs an incredible feeling, and it‚Äôs only just sinking in in the locker room.‚Äù

Midfielder Elvis Rexhbecaj praised the team‚Äôs defensive effort, which laid the foundation for their triumph. ‚ÄúDefensively, we were outstanding today,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúEveryone enjoyed defending - it was a joy to be part of it.‚Äù

Head coach Manuel Baum highlighted both the performance and the mentality behind the result. ‚ÄúAn outstanding outcome, and the lads deserved it,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI was convinced the players would have to earn the belief that they could have a chance against Bayern. We wanted to create a day we will remember for years, and I think we‚Äôve achieved that. Simply a fantastic performance from the guys, and I‚Äôm very proud.‚Äù

The voices from Augsburg‚Äôs camp underline the combination of belief, discipline, and sheer determination that fueled one of the Bundesliga‚Äôs most dramatic upsets this season.

title: An important performance - Robins
description: Stoke City manager Mark Robins praised his depleted squad for fighting back to earn a draw at Birmingham City
fullText:
Stoke City manager Mark Robins praised his players for battling back from a goal down at Birmingham despite having 11 players injured and defender Bosun Lawal suspended.

He told BBC Radio Stoke: "It was an important performance because we are [down to the] bare bones and everyone knows it and sees it, but the packed-out away end was phenomenal and backed us all the way.

"The players really appreciate that. I thought we were the better team in the first half and created some decent openings that we usually don't take anyway.

"We've got 12 players out and the majority of those are first-team starters, or have been, so to put in a performance like that was really pleasing.

"[Birmingham] have been good at home this year and we gave as good as we got, could have taken some chances, and had chances to create shooting opportunities which we turned down - that's the only criticism, I want them to shoot, have a go.

"We conceded a really poor goal, but the response was emphatic, a brilliant delivery from Cressy."

title: Eleven-try Saracens thump Newcastle Red Bulls
description: Four tries from Noah Caluori helps eleven-try Saracens ruthlessly beat Newcastle Red Bulls 73-14 in The Prem at a blustery StoneX Stadium.
fullText:
Tries: Penalty Try, Segun, Caluori 4, Onyeama-Christie, Hadfield 2, Mawi, Tompkins Cons: Farrell 8

Tries: Usher, Parsons Cons: Connon 2

Noah Caluori scored four tries to help Saracens thump Newcastle Red Bulls 73-14 at a blustery StoneX Stadium.

Sarries ran in eleven tries in their first match since it was announced long-standing director of rugby Mark McCall is to step down at the end of the season.

The home side put aside a difficult opening 15 minutes against The Prem's bottom club to secure the biggest margin of victory in the competition so far this season.

Newcastle, who had two men sin-binned during a chastening afternoon, were totally outclassed as they were unable to build on their first league win of the season last time out.

Following Leicester's big win at Harlequins, Saracens stay sixth while Newcastle remain rooted to the foot of the table.

Van Poortvliet shines as Leicester dominate Quins

Saracens were forced into making two alterations from their original starting XV just minutes before the match after Marco Riccioni and Theo McFarland picked up injuries in the warm-up. They were replaced by Tietie Tuimauga - making his Saracens debut - and experienced Argentina international Juan Martin Gonzalez.

And those late changes seemed to unsettle the hosts as Newcastle grabbed an early advantage when Alex Hearle's break helped set up 21-year-old lock Oscar Usher to crash over for the visitors.

Newcastle made a blistering start to the match and should have extended their lead but, inexplicably, Tom Christie failed to dot the ball down after going behind the in-goal area, with Sarries scrum-half Charlie Bracken forcing him out of touch.

That moment woke Saracens up and they levelled through a penalty try when Newcastle scrum-half Simon Benitez Cruz was adjudged to have deliberately knocked-on in front of his own line, meaning he also spent 10 minutes in the bin.

Saracens wing Rotimi Segun then put his side's untidy first 15 minutes to bed when his wonderful chip and run took him past the Newcastle defence and dot down in the left corner.

Caluori ‚Äì who was left out of England's 36-man squad for this year's Six Nations yesterday ‚Äì then got on the end of a deft kick from full-back Elliot Daly to open up a two-score lead.

After Andy Onyeama-Christie had a try disallowed because of a knock-on in the build-up, Caluori got his second when he ran a beautiful line to meet a Daly pass before scoring in what is quickly becoming trademark fashion.

With Newcastle wing Elliott Obatoyinbo in the sin-bin after being shown a yellow card for offside a minute before half-time, Onyeama-Christie did eventually get his name on the scoresheet a minute after the interval when he juggled a short pass before dotting down under the sticks.

Caluori then completed his hat-trick inside 43 minutes when Sarries moved the ball smartly from left to right to force an overload which resulted in a simple finish for the teenager.

At that stage, the hosts were turning on the style and, off the bench, James Hadfield dotted down after a successful Saracens maul.

Fijian Eroni Mawi then got the half-century up for Saracens when he crashed over from a metre out, before Hadfield claimed his second with a pick-and-drive from close range under the sticks.

A Nick Tompkins kick downfield was then beautifully collected one-handed by Caluori who raced clear to dot down in the right corner for his fourth.

Tompkins then grabbed Saracens' eleventh and final try before Newcastle's Reuben Parsons, making his Prem debut, had the final word when he touched down with the final act of the day.

Saracens: Daly; Caluori, Lozowski, Tompkins, Segun; Farrell (capt), C. Bracken; Carre, George, Tuimauga, Isiekwe, Tizard, Gonzalez, Onyeama-Christie, Willis.

Replacements: Hadfield, Mawi, Beaton, Wilson, Michelow, van Zyl, Burke, Malins.

Newcastle Red Bulls: Grayson; Wade, Hearle, Arnold, E. Obatoyinbo; Connon, Benitez Cruz; McCallum, McGuigan (capt), Palframan, Usher, Hodgson, Gordon, Christie, Lockwood.

Replacements: Fletcher, Brocklebank, De Bruin, Baker, Parsons, Elliott, Hutchison, Spencer.

Sin-bin: Benitez Cruz (8 mins), E. Obatoyinbo (39 mins).

title: Bruins Eager For ‚ÄòSpecial Game‚Äô Against Canadiens In Pivotal Divisional Showdown
description: The Boston Bruins are set to host the Montreal Canadiens in a pivotal Atlantic Division showdown on Saturday night. Boston is chasing the Canadiens for the third spot in the division, as the Bruins are three points back of Montreal. With Boston chasing down the Canadiens, Bruins defenseman Nikita Zadorov knows this is a crucial [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Boston Bruins are set to host the Montreal Canadiens in a pivotal Atlantic Division showdown on Saturday night.

Boston is chasing the Canadiens for the third spot in the division, as the Bruins are three points back of Montreal. With Boston chasing down the Canadiens, Bruins defenseman Nikita Zadorov knows this is a crucial game for the standings.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre three points behind them, so it‚Äôs a four-point game for sure,‚Äù Zadorov said pregame on Saturday. ‚ÄúSaturday night in our building, it should be fun for sure. There‚Äôs a lot of history between these teams. It‚Äôs nice to be part of it.‚Äù

Bruins head coach, Marco Sturm, meanwhile, knows a Boston vs. Montreal game is always special.

But, with both teams jockeying for playoff position, Sturm said it adds to the game and Boston has plenty of confidence heading into the matchup.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always a special game playing against these guys,‚Äù Sturm said. ‚ÄúWe feel pretty good about our game. I think that‚Äôs the most important thing.‚Äù

Boston is coming off a 4-3 win over the Vegas Golden Knights on Thursday. The Bruins are 1-1-0 against Montreal this season, with the last meeting coming on Dec. 23 in a 6-2 loss.

Puck drop for Boston vs. Montreal on Saturday night is set for 7 p.m. ET. Pregame coverage on NESN begins at 6 p.m. ET.

title: Injury analyst offers encouraging Ja Morant update
description: Ja Morant might not miss a ton of time.
fullText:
Injury analyst offers encouraging Ja Morant update originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Ja Morant is going to miss some time for the Memphis Grizzlies.

On Saturday, the team announced that Morant is officially dealing with a UCL sprain in his left elbow. He suffered it against the Atlanta Hawks, which marked just his second game back on January 21. The Grizzlies are going to evaluate Morant again in three weeks.

Just because he‚Äôll get evaluated then, doesn‚Äôt mean he‚Äôs guaranteed to return. While nobody can say Morant will be healed up in under a month, injury analyst Jeff Stotts has good news on Morant, based on history with NBA players dealing with a UCL-related injury.

Via @InStreetClothes: New Ja Morant Injury Update: Elbow UCL injuries are commonplace in baseball (think Tommy John) but not in the NBA. Average missed time lost for a mild to moderate UCL elbow sprain? ~11. 8 games (~22 days).

Morant‚Äôs re-evaluation timeline comes right around the league‚Äôs All-Star break. It seems there could be a high chance he won‚Äôt return to the court until after the break. The Grizzlies are set to wrap up a long road trip against the Denver Nuggets on February 11, which still falls under the timeline.

They return to the court on February 20 to host the Utah Jazz.

The Grizzlies don‚Äôt have a need to rush Morant back on the floor. This is just another setback for the star, who has struggled in all ways, including availability this year. At this point, the Grizzlies are 18-25 on the season, winning just three of their past 10 games.

Memphis ranks 12th in the Western Conference, sitting right behind the Dallas Mavericks. While they are still hovering around the Play-In, there is still a lot of basketball left to be played.

The Grizzlies will take the floor again on Sunday for a 3:30 PM ET tip.

title: Pirates' Paul Skenes can set all-time MLB record by breaking history of Dodgers legend
description: He's on an all-time great trajectory already.
fullText:
Pirates' Paul Skenes can set all-time MLB record by breaking history of Dodgers legend originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Paul Skenes is one of the best pitchers on the planet, and that really hasn't been questioned at any point during his first two MLB seasons with the Pittsburgh Pirates.

If he keeps this up, he'll have a chance to make all kinds of history and set all sorts of records.

In 2026, Skenes could set two records if he keeps up his current pace.

MLB.com's Sarah Langs wrote a new article this weekend breaking down the different all-time marks that could fall in the 2026 MLB season. Skenes featured prominently on the list.

MORE:¬†Bo Bichette comments exhibit clear hyprocrisy

The first record that could be set is if Skenes leads the National League in ERA. It'd be the second consecutive year that he led in ERA.

Skenes would be the youngest to lead his league in ERA in back-to-back seasons since it was an official stat in 1913, according to Langs.

That previous record is currently held by Clayton Kershaw.

Skenes also could set a strikeout record.

"Skenes is also projected to lead the NL in strikeouts, with 237," Langs writes. "He would be the fifth youngest to lead his league in both ERA and strikeouts by age at the end of the season, older than only 1985 Gooden (20 years, 324 days), 1940 Bob Feller (21 years, 331 days), 1965 Sam McDowell (23 years, 12 days) and 2011 Kershaw (23 years, 193 days)."

MORE:¬†The Reds aren't signing any free agents because of TV

The key to the Pirates' season ahead really isn't Skenes, though. They're expecting him to be a superstar, as usual.

Pittsburgh needs the rest of its roster to live up to Skenes. If Skenes can get some help, this can be a sneakily dangerous club.

title: How promise to mom led Charles Bediako back to Alabama basketball
description: After three seasons in the G League, Charles Bediako came back to Alabama basketball, fueled by a promise he once made to his mother.
fullText:
Even when Charles Bediako declared for the NBA Draft in 2023, he left the door open on his future with Alabama basketball.

While then, Bediako probably imagined he might return to the program for his junior season instead of forgoing his remaining eligibility, he almost certainly didn‚Äôt picture the route that has positioned him to come off the bench for Alabama against Tennesseee after three seasons in the pros.

With a temporary restraining order that allowed Bediako‚Äôs collegiate comeback, he was also granted the chance to fulfill a promise that he made to his mother while doing what he loves.

‚ÄòANGRY CHUCK‚Äô: Charles Bediako explains story behind old Alabama basketball nickname

REQUIRED READING: Nate Oats responds to college coaches ripping Alabama, Charles Bediako

In an interview with UA‚Äôs NIL collective, Bediako touched on why he re-enrolled as a student at Alabama and started classes in the spring semester.

‚ÄúBefore I committed to the University of Alabama, I promised my mom, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm going to get a degree, no matter what it is,‚Äô‚Äù Bediako said. ‚ÄúBasketball is great and all, but I told her I‚Äôm going to get a degree. My older brother, he got a degree at Santa Clara. My younger sister, who is a junior at Marquette, she‚Äôs still at her school. Now I‚Äôm here. My mom‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs only right that you get your education and finish.‚Äô I said, ‚ÄòOf course.‚Äô So I‚Äôm happy.‚Äù

Bediako‚Äôs mom isn‚Äôt the only one who is happy to see the 23-year-old back in the classroom.

‚ÄúThey have been very supportive. My brother has probably been the most excited. I would say he was probably the most excited. My sister, she was also happy. My mom was just happy as well. She was happy that I was happy. Especially just coming back to get a degree, a future education. Because basketball won‚Äôt always be there,‚Äù Bediako said.

‚ÄúThe mind is everything. When you get a degree, no one can take that from you. You earned it. You worked for it.‚Äù

Emilee Smarr covers Alabama basketball and Crimson Tide athletics for The Tuscaloosa News. She can be reached via email at esmarr@usatodayco.com.

This article originally appeared on The Tuscaloosa News: A promise to his mom led Charles Bediako back to Alabama basketball

title: üëÅÔ∏è After Bayern‚Äôs streak ends, Leverkusen keep a close eye
description: After the 1:2 defeat against FC Augsburg, it is clear: Even in the 2025/26 season, FC Bayern will not succeed in finishing a Bundesliga season undefeated. This is particularly pleasing to Bayer Leverk...
fullText:
After the 1:2 defeat against FC Augsburg, it is clear: Even in the 2025/26 season, FC Bayern will not succeed in finishing a Bundesliga season undefeated. This is particularly pleasing to Bayer Leverkusen.

The "Werkself" crowned the 2023/2024 season not only with the championship but also without suffering a single defeat in the league. FC Bayern dreamed of this until the very end, which they confidently displayed on 'X' just yesterday.

To the chagrin of the record champions, pride came before the fall here as well. Leverkusen was only too happy to rub it in Munich's face.

title: Former UNC basketball sharpshooter thriving in NBA G League
description: Cormac Ryan was the best pure shooter on UNC's 2023-24 basketball squad. Ryan is now thriving in the NBA G League.
fullText:
The 2023-24 UNC basketball team is one of the program's best teams to never win a championship. Complete with an experienced, talented roster that showcased immense chemistry, how the season ended was a disappointment.

You might recognize a few names on this roster: RJ Davis, Armando Bacot and Harrison Ingram. All three dabbled with the NBA. Davis and Ingram are currently in the G League, while Bacot is playing overseas.

The best pure shooter on that 2023-24 North Carolina roster, though, is Cormac Ryan. Transferring in from Notre Dame during the prior offseason, Ryan finished his lone season in Carolina Blue second in 3-point percentage (.354) and free throw percentage (.874).

Now a member of the G-League's Wisconsin Herd, who are affiliated with the NBA's Milwaukee Bucks, Ryan is thriving in his second pro season.

Ryan is averaging 21.4 points per game on 50% field goal shooting, a 42% mark from deep and 90% mark from the free throw line.

The Herd are just 6-8 as of Saturday morning, but they have a true leader in Ryan. Question is: when will Milwaukee call Ryan up to make his NBA regular season debut?

It's no secret the 2025-26 Tar Heels could use Ryan's shooting prowess on their roster, particularly from the free throw line. UNC has its best frontcourt in years, led by Caleb Wilson and Henri Veesaar, but backcourt production is still coming into its own.

That 2023-24 North Carolina squad lost to Alabama in a heartbreaking, Sweet 16 result. Can the current Tar Heels make it a few steps deeper and bring a National Championship back to Chapel Hill?

title: Hornets' Liam McNeeley nears 20-point performance in G League
description: Hornets rookie Liam McNeeley produced another double-digit-scoring effort in the G League on Friday, helping Greensboro to a road win over Maine.
fullText:
Charlotte Hornets rookie Liam McNeeley produced another double-digit-scoring effort in the G League on Friday, helping the Greensboro Swarm to a road win over the Maine Celtics.

McNeeley finished with 19 points, seven assists and four rebounds in the 122-112 victory at the Portland Expo Building. He went 6-of-12 from the field, including 2-of-4 from 3-point range, and was a plus-12 in 36 minutes, 40 seconds of action.

The 29th pick tallied 10 points in the second half, ensuring the Swarm held on to win their fourth straight game. He converted several tough finishes at the rim for and-1 opportunities, while also mixing in a couple of long-range 3-pointers during his time on the court.

Deep 3ü´°#10YearsOfSwarm | #SwarmOn pic.twitter.com/AbhNQCd6Gy

‚Äî Greensboro Swarm (@greensboroswarm) January 24, 2026

McNeeley has played sporadically with the Hornets, averaging 4.3 points and 2.2 rebounds in 27 games. The team has periodically assigned him to the Swarm to log extended playing time and work on various elements of his game on the court.

The 20-year-old is averaging 20.4 points, 6.3 rebounds and 4.9 assists on 43.2% shooting from the field in nine appearances with the Swarm. He has scored at least 20 points five times, including a 27-point effort on Dec. 27 in a win over the Iowa Wolves.

McNeeley has played at a high level with the Swarm, showcasing his playmaking and scoring. The organization has liked the way he has performed and will continue to explore opportunities for him in the G League as part of his development plan.

This article originally appeared on Rookie Wire: Hornets news: Liam McNeeley nears 20-point performance in G League

title: Fulham bounce back with late win against Brighton
description: Fulham return to winning ways with a 2-1 comeback win against Brighton at Craven Cottage on Saturday.
fullText:
Fulham returned to winning ways with a 2-1 comeback win against Brighton at Craven Cottage on Saturday after their impressive six-game unbeaten run had come to a screeching halt at Leeds last week.

Looking for a response at Craven Cottage, Marco Silva's side created more than Brighton early on with Raul Jimenez's near-post effort in the 24th minute denied by a fine save from Bart Verbruggen.

However, Yasin Ayari's brilliant opener proved to be a shock to their system - one from which they failed to recover in the first half.

Silva turned to his bench to spark the comeback with Samuel Chukwueze, on his return from the Africa Cup of Nations, grabbing the equaliser 13 minutes after coming on.

Fulham have now had 33 goal involvements from their substitutes since the start of the 2024-25 Premier League season, with only Brighton (39) recording more.

The winner came in the dying moments as Harry Wilson's clever free-kick sent Brighton keeper Verbruggen scrambling across his goal in vain as the Wales international scored his ninth goal of the season.

Since the start of November, only Erling Haaland (12) has been involved in more league goals than Wilson, who has scored seven and assisted four in 14 appearances.

The win that helped them climb to seventh should give Fulham plenty of confidence before they take on fifth-placed Manchester United at Old Trafford next week.

title: Iowa wrestling coach Tom Brands notches major career milestone
description: Iowa wrestling bounced back with a big rivalry win over No. 6 Nebraska, securing a career milestone for Tom Brands in the process.
fullText:
Iowa wrestling (9-3, 2-1 Big Ten) bounced back into the win column with a big rivalry win at No. 6 Nebraska (9-4, 2-1 Big Ten) on Friday, securing a massive career milestone for head coach Tom Brands in the process.

With the 22-14 victory, Brands now collects his 300th career dual meet win as the head coach of the Hawkeyes. Brands' overall record in 20 seasons at the helm improves to 300-31-1 and 143-16 against Big Ten opponents.

300 at IOWA ü§ù pic.twitter.com/QVoi5MnrNd

‚Äî Iowa Hawkeye Wrestling (@Hawks_Wrestling) January 24, 2026

This milestone is yet another impressive stat to add to Brands' illustrious tenure at the helm in Iowa City, which includes five Big Ten Coach of the Year awards (2008, 2009, 2010, 2020, 2021) and three NWCA Coach of the Year awards (2008, 2020, 2021).

Including his 11 seasons as an assistant coach for the Hawkeyes, he secured the 2000 NWCA Assistant Coach of the Year, USA Wrestling Freestyle Coach of the Year twice (2002 and 2003), and the 2002 Walter Camp national Coach of the Year award.

Collegiately, Brands was a four-time All-American at Iowa (1989-92), in which he won three NCAA titles and was named Outstanding Wrestler of the 1992 NCAA Championships. He was also a three-time Big Ten champion, with a career mark of 158-7-2, including an undefeated season in 1991 (45-0).

The Hawkeyes will look to improve Brands' record even further on Jan. 30, when the program hosts Minnesota (10-2, 2-2 Big Ten) from Carver-Hawkeye Arena.

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander won't use OKC's injuries as excuse for loss to Pacers
description: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander won't use OKC's injuries as excuse for loss to Indiana Pacers.
fullText:
Getting past Andrew Nembhard with ease, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander went with the up-and-under move to finish through traffic for the driving layup in the final seconds. The bucket was the last of a monstrous outing that should've resulted in a win. And a game where OKC should've lived or died with the ball in his hands.

The Oklahoma City Thunder couldn't survive their recent uptick of injuries in their 117-114 loss to the Indiana Pacers. We learned that you can't win a game when only three NBA players have positive contributions.

Gilgeous-Alexander finished with 47 points on 17-of-28 shooting, four assists and four rebounds. He shot 1-of-4 from 3 and went 12-of-12 on free throws. He also had a steal and a block.

Well, if there was ever a game for Gilgeous-Alexander to empty the tank, it's this one. The Thunder didn't have any other viable on-ball scorer. That was painfully obvious in this game. Jalen Williams remains out. Ajay Mitchell and Aaron Wiggins also joined him as guys out.

When Gilgeous-Alexander was on the floor, the offense flowed fine. Off, though, yeesh. Not enough Jaylin Williams DHO handoffs in the world could solve things. Those elements crafted a game where you saw the 30-point machine leave it all on the floor as a high-volume scorer.

The Pacers had no way to stop Gilgeous-Alexander. He knifed through their defense to get several looks. When that didn't happen, he got to his mid-range spots without any problem at the elbow and baseline. Indiana had to resort to fouling him as he was relentless at putting his head down and barreling towards the rim.

Nembhard has had some success over the years ‚Äî better than most, at least ‚Äî but it didn't matter. Gilgeous-Alexander was in the zone. He put up 29 points in the second half. He had 15 in the fourth quarter as he tried to play Superman and drag OKC to the finish line.

Instead, Gilgeous-Alexander painted a masterpiece that ended up in waste. He almost proved that you could win an NBA game with one high-end scorer. The short-handed Thunder couldn't prop up enough help to make sure this performance stole headlines for the right reasons.

"No matter what, every team goes through injuries. No team has been 100% all year in the history of the game. Injuries are going to happen. It's about the next guy being able to play," Gilgeous-Alexander said. "We have a roster full of games that could, no matter what, come in and play."

And then there was the final possession. In a vacuum, Isaiah Joe's outside look was fine. The sharpshooter knocks that down in his sleep. But I feel like the ball should've been in Gilgeous-Alexander's hands. Even if Indiana immediately doubles and refuses to concede a one-on-one perimeter look. Let the reigning MVP decide what to do next from there.

That's happened a couple of times in the final possession of close games. The Thunder have struggled to let Gilgeous-Alexander decide the final result. Even when he takes over fourth quarters like he did tonight. The Pacers failed to prove they couldn't stop him. So no reason to bail them out.

"Naturally, the ball is in my hands more because there's less playmakers out there. I'm pretty sure my usage rate has been higher the last two nights than I was averaging when we were completely healthy," Gilgeous-Alexander said. "Whatever the game calls for, I just plug in and do. If I need to be on it more in a certain situation, I'm on it. If not, then I won't be."

This article originally appeared on OKC Thunder Wire: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander won't use injuries as excuse for loss to Pacers

title: Louisville women's basketball avoids trap, remains perfect in ACC play
description: Jeff Walz and the Louisville Cardinals are 9-0 in ACC play. Louisville women's basketball rolled to a win over Boston College at the KFC Yum! Center.
fullText:
Louisville¬†women‚Äôs basketball hosting¬†Boston College¬†on Saturday had all the makings of a trap game.

The seventh-ranked¬†Cardinals¬†were coming off two difficult¬†wins, at Notre Dame and N.C. State,¬†the weekend before. Then, their game against the Eagles, who were on a 13-game losing streak,¬†had to be played a day early due to¬†Winter Storm Fern. Louisville (19-3, 9-0 ACC)¬†didn‚Äôt¬†have the cleanest start to the game, turning the ball over six times in the first quarter. But the squad proved its ability to push through mistakes and avoid the trap, recording a 85-56 win over Boston College (4-18,0-9) at the¬†KFC Yum! Center.

UofL¬†downing¬†N.C. State and Notre Dame on the road showed how high its celling could be. Avoiding¬†a letup¬†in less competitive games¬†will be critical for the Cardinals as they remain in the¬†hunt for¬†a regular-season ACC championship.¬†Four¬†of the Cardinals' final¬†nine¬†ACC opponents have¬†losing¬†records¬†in conference play.

Mackenly Randolph¬†took her turn leading the Cardinals with a career high-tying 13 points as the team recorded its 12th¬†straight victory.¬†It was the sixth straight game where UofL had a different leading scorer.¬†The offense was needed¬†to make up for the team‚Äôs turnover problem, many of which have been unforced.¬†Louisville¬†had¬†a combined¬†21 turnovers¬†against the Wolfpack and Irish¬†last weekend¬†but had 16¬†after¬†the third quarter against Boston College.

The Eagles only totaled nine points¬†off the miscues as part of a struggling offense that knocked down 29% of its shots from the field.

When they¬†weren‚Äôt¬†turning it over, the¬†Cardinals¬†were efficient shooters. They¬†made¬†55% of their field goals¬†with all 12 of their available players¬†entering¬†the scoring column.¬†UofL built a 10-0 lead¬†in the first quarter,¬†and Boston College never got closer than eight points¬†for the rest of the game.¬†The Cardinals‚Äô lead ballooned to 42¬†points in the first four minutes of the fourth¬†quarter,¬†and the squad sailed to a win.

Louisville has a road trip out west next week, beginning with Stanford at 8 p.m. Thursday and California at 2 p.m. next Sunday.

Reach¬†Louisville football, women's basketball and baseball beat writer Alexis Cubit at¬†acubit@gannett.com¬†and follow her on X at @Alexis_Cubit.

title: Joe Flacco reveals chance of playing for Steelers in 2026 to replace Aaron Rodgers
description: This would be quite the turn of events.
fullText:
Joe Flacco reveals chance of playing for Steelers in 2026 to replace Aaron Rodgers originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Joe Flacco... in a Pittsburgh Steelers uniform?

The veteran isn't ruling out the possibility as he heads into free agency.

To be fair to Flacco, he was specifically asked about the Steelers on the latest edition of of the BMore Football Podcast. He didn't bring it up by himself. But he gave an honest answer.

"There's something about the Steelers that seems a little bit different because they were our rival for so many years," Flacco said. "But at the end of the day, I play football because I love it. It is a job of mine. If somebody is hiring me, that is a pretty big deal."

MORE:¬†Winter storm could set up some NFL records

Flacco, of course, did his best work in the NFL for the Baltimore Ravens, including winning a Super Bowl.

He has also played for the Cleveland Browns and Cincinnati Bengals, so the Steelers are the only AFC North squad he hasn't touched yet.

Flacco has also played for the Indianapolis Colts in his NFL career, which he doesn't want to end yet.

"I've tried to come up with a good answer for everybody, but it's a hard question to answer," Flacco said. "I've played football most of my life. I think you think about an end. You do think about one day being done, but at the same time, year to year, you don't really think about that. You're just like, 'Oh, offseason. Time to work out and get ready for the next season.' And I think that for the most part, my head is still in that space."

MORE:¬†Could the Raiders trade the No. 1 pick and Fernando Mendoza?

He did have a huge game against the Steelers in 2025 for the Bengals, throwing for 342 yards and three touchdowns while leading a game-winning drive.

And Pittsburgh could use a bridge quarterback in 2026, particularly if Aaron Rodgers decides to retire. So never say never.

title: Umar Nurmagomedov‚Äôs reaction to Dillon Danis UFC brawl raises eyebrows as feud escalates
description: Umar Nurmagomedov did not leave UFC 322 entirely satisfied. The bantamweight contender had a front-row seat as Islam Makhachev defeated Jack Della Maddalena to claim the welterweight title at Madison Square Garden in November.
fullText:
Umar Nurmagomedov did not leave UFC 322 entirely satisfied.

The bantamweight contender had a front-row seat as Islam Makhachev defeated Jack Della Maddalena to claim the welterweight title at Madison Square Garden in November. It should have been a huge moment for his team, but attention quickly shifted elsewhere.

Makhachev‚Äôs win was overshadowed by a brawl breaking out in the crowd. The incident involved several members of the Dagestani‚Äôs camp and one of Conor McGregor‚Äôs long-time training partners.

Dillon Danis, known for stirring controversy, found himself at the centre of a fight with Makhachev‚Äôs team during UFC 322.

The incident left Danis with minor injuries and led to his removal from the event. He later had to pull out of a scheduled bout against Anthony Taylor.

However, Nurmagomedov still thinks he deserved a worse fate.

‚ÄúThis guy talked too much,‚Äù he told Complex.

‚ÄúHe talks about religion. He talks about family. He talks about a lot of things.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not good. You can‚Äôt be that person and not expect people to smash you.‚Äù

When questioned if he enjoyed watching Danis being defeated, Nurmagomedov responded: ‚ÄúNot enough.

‚ÄúHe has to be broken. Some legs and arms.

‚ÄúHe has to be in his hospital between life and death. He deserves it.‚Äù

Nurmagomedov is aiming to position himself for another bantamweight title shot when he steps into the Octagon at UFC 324.

The 30-year-old will face off against former two-time flyweight champion Deiveson Figueiredo in Las Vegas on Saturday night.

A victory could put him in line for a bout with the new bantamweight champion, Petr Yan.

But there is also growing interest in a potential rematch between Yan and Merab Dvalishvili, which could take priority.

Another option for Yan is to take on the winner of Sean O‚ÄôMalley vs Song Yadong, also set to take place at UFC 324.

title: Ja Morant injury: Grizzlies star (elbow) out through trade deadline
description: Ja Morant has been a popular name in trade talks, but an injury may halt any potential moves.
fullText:
Any team looking to acquire Ja Morant before the NBA trade deadline would have to wait a bit before he sees the floor. The Memphis Grizzlies announced Saturday that Morant is out through the Feb. 5 deadline due to a UCL sprain he suffered against the Atlanta Hawks on Jan. 21.

Morant, the oft-injured guard who has already missed time this season with a calf contusion, will be reevaluated in three weeks. The former No. 2 overall pick has never played more than 67 games in a season, and since 2023-24 he's only played 79 games.

This latest injury complicates the trade talks that have hounded Morant this season. Morant spoke passive-aggressively about his coaching staff after a poor showing against the Los Angeles Lakers on Halloween, resulting in a one-game suspension. By January the Grizzlies reportedly began entertaining offers on Morant, though the Murray State product stated publicly he wanted to remain in Memphis.

The Milwaukee Bucks, Sacramento Kings and Miami Heat emerged as potential Morant destinations. None are particularly exciting, so perhaps that explains why Morant changed his tune.

It's thus far been a frustrating career for Morant. He earned All-Star honors in 2021-22 and 2022-23 while leading the Grizzlies to the No. 2 seed in each of those seasons. Morant is also wildly popular in Memphis and beyond, with a Nike signature shoe to boot. But between the injuries, off-court drama and failure to evolve his offensive game, the cons are seemingly outweighing the pros.

Morant is far too talented to give up on, though, and his latest injury suggests he'll try to bounce back in the city he was drafted to.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Ja Morant injury: Grizzlies star out through NBA trade deadline

title: Mikel Arteta details why Arsenal signed Viktor Gyokeres over Benjamin Sesko
description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has explained why his side opted to sign Viktor Gyokeres instead of Manchester United star Benjamin Sesko.Sesko getting up to speedUnited headed into the summer transfer w...
fullText:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has explained why his side opted to sign Viktor Gyokeres instead of Manchester United star Benjamin Sesko.

United headed into the summer transfer window with a clear objective of bolstering their attacking department after a goal-shy 2024/25 campaign. The club forked out north of ¬£200m on the signings of Matheus Cunha, Bryan Mbeumo and Sesko.

The Red Devils had kept tabs on Sesko for several years before finally landing him. He has displayed flashes of his considerable potential, particularly through his intelligent movement, aerial prowess, and hold-up play. However, as the player himself has acknowledged, there remains significant room for development before he can be considered a complete striker.

Sesko has made 17 Premier League appearances so far, contributing four goals and one assist.

The Slovenian‚Äôs future at Old Trafford looks bright but he could have easily been playing for Arsenal. Like United, the Gunners had earmarked Sesko as a primary target.

Arsenal held talks with both RB Leipzig and Sesko‚Äôs representatives but the North London outfit eventually opted to shift their attention elsewhere instead, completing a ¬£64m deal for Gyokeres. Interestingly, Gyokeres was also strongly linked with United, in part due to the prospect of reuniting with his former coach, Ruben Amorim.

Gyokeres‚Äô record-breaking form in Portugal has yet to translate into fireworks in the Premier League.

Ahead of United‚Äôs meeting with Arsenal at the Emirates on Sunday, Arteta revealed why they settled on Gyokeres ahead of Sesko.

Asked why Gyokeres instead of Sesko, the 43-year-old answered [as quoted by the Metro], ‚ÄúWell, at the end, we have to make a decision, and we believed that Victor was the best one in the scenario that we were in.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe qualities that we didn‚Äôt have in that number nine as well, because we have the situation with Gabby and Kai out for many, many months, and we are very happy to have him.‚Äù

He added about Gyokeres‚Äô attributes, ‚ÄúWell, first of all, goals. Someone that can guarantee you goals.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe know that word doesn‚Äôt exist, but then someone very direct, very powerful, a proper nine who can stretch the pitch, who has the goal between the eyes, and somebody that can stretch the pitch for us a bit more, especially when we have to play against certain opposition.‚Äù

When pressed further on Gyokeres‚Äôs underwhelming start in England, Arteta was predictably guarded on the subject, urging patience and more time for the Swedish striker to adapt.

Arsenal vs. United kicks off at 4.30pm.

Featured image Gareth Copley via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Seahawks get important $33 million Kenneth Walker contract projection
description: Kenneth Walker is a priority free agent after Zach Charbonnet's injury.
fullText:
Seahawks get important $33 million Kenneth Walker contract projection originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Seattle Seahawks are in the NFC Championship and are going up against the Los Angeles Rams for a chance to go to the Super Bowl.

For the Seahawks, there's nothing more important than this game. But that doesn't mean preparing for the future should be completely ignored. This offseason, the Seahawks will have a big decision to make with Kenneth Walker.

According to Spotrac.com, Walker received a $33 million contract projection, which is significant news for the Seahawks. Thanks to Zach Charbonnet's season-ending ACL tear, Walker's return to Seattle is a much more relevant issue than before.

Spotrac's Market Value has Walker projected to land a $33,591,380 contract this offseason over four years.

While he's not the highest projected deal for a running back, behind players like Chase Brown, D'Andre Swift, Breece Hall, and Devon Achane, this projected contract is a very noteworthy one for the Seahawks.

Charbonnet might not be able to play right away in 2026, and if he's missing time, then the Seahawks wouldn't have a running back ready to go on the roster.

Walker is a free agent, and the rest of the running back room are backups or practice squad players. Adding a running back is a priority for the Seahawks this offseason, and bringing Walker back makes too much sense.

While this $33 million deal wouldn't be cheap, with the projected contract lasting four years and around $8.4 million per year, it's a very reasonable deal for the Seahawks.

More:¬†Kenneth Walker's contract situation looms large after dominant showing vs. 49ers

This season, Walker had 1,027 rushing yards with five touchdowns on 221 attempts. It's not his best season, but in a split backfield with Charbonnet, it's an impressive year for the 25-year-old running back.

His playoff performance against the San Francisco 49ers, 116 rushing yards and three touchdowns on 19 attempts, with 29 receiving yards on three catches, should bolster his market this offseason.

The value that Walker provides to the Seahawks is worth the $33 million projected deal from Spotrac.com. He's a great running back and is a very important offseason decision for the Seahawks following Charbonnet's injury.

title: What Ferrari fans in Maranello do every time the team win a Formula 1 race
description: Ferrari failed to win a Formula 1 race during the 2025 season. It‚Äôs already the third time this decade that this has happened.
fullText:
Ferrari failed to win a Formula 1 race during the 2025 season. It‚Äôs already the third time this decade that this has happened.

One of the founding members of the championship in 1950, Ferrari have had 16 winless seasons. Five of those have come since 2014.

Indeed, between 1994 and 2013 ‚Äì the period that included Michael Schumacher‚Äôs record run of four straight championships ‚Äì Ferrari won at least one race every single year.

One has to go back to the 2024 Mexico City GP, when Carlos Sainz won his final race for the Scuderia, for the last time they stood on the top step of the podium. At the time of writing, the drought has reached 28 races.

Despite their recent difficulties, Ferrari are the most successful team in F1 history. They are just two wins shy of 250, while nearest challengers McLaren have only just cleared 200.

The Ferrari F1 team are based in a small city called Maranello in the Emilia Romagna region of Italy. While there are fewer than 18,000 inhabitants, the presence of the Prancing Horse makes it a famous destination.

As reported by The Times, local Ferrari fans mark every race win by ringing the bells of the San Biagio church. Meanwhile, the team raise a flag at the factory.

At the start of every season, the flags are taken down, a move that highlights Ferrari‚Äôs winning mentality. The flagpoles were left vacant last year, but the Tifosi are hoping the major regulation changes present an opportunity.

Many of the residents of Maranello are Ferrari employees. It‚Äôs estimated that the team have around 1,050 staff (via Kym Illman), although they are very rarely in the same place.

Mercedes top the list with 1,250, while Williams sit in a surprising second place alongside Red Bull (1,200).

Williams are one of F1‚Äôs most iconic outfits but they haven‚Äôt won a world championship in the 21st century. When the family sold the eponymous team, they were fighting for survival and struggling near the back of the grid.

Ferrari beat out McLaren, Aston Martin and Alpine (1,000) for fourth place. Sauber (previously 750 employees) will likely expand following Audi‚Äôs takeover.

Red Bull sister team Racing Bulls have around 700 staff, while Haas are comfortably F1‚Äôs smallest team (350). Cadillac are joining the grid this year, so it remains to be seen where they slot in.

title: Barca star Bernal wanted on loan by Ajax
description: Another admirer to add to the list.
fullText:
Eredivisie giants Ajax seem to have become the latest club to take an interest in Barcelona midfielder Marc Bernal as we head towards the end of the January transfer window.

Girona have already been linked with a loan move for the midfielder, and Ajax are also keen on a temporary deal, according to Diario Sport.

The club have received good reports on Bernal from Jordi Cruyff, who is set to become the club‚Äôs new sporting director at the start of February.

Bernal is having to be patient at Barcelona this season when it comes to starts, although Hansi Flick has made it clear he does not want him to go anywhere this winter.

‚ÄúI hope he stays. My opinion is clear, but in football you never know what can happen,‚Äù he told reporters last weekend.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs coming back from an injury, he‚Äôs improving and getting back into shape. He has a lot of potential and we want to help him reach that potential.‚Äù

Bernal could be set for a big week with Barcelona. Flick will be without Pedri and Frenkie de Jong against Copenhagen on Wednesday in the Champions League, with Bernal tipped to start what is a crucial game.

title: Frankie Kazarian Shares His Thoughts On The WWE-TNA Relationship
description: Former TNA World Champion Frankie Kazarian weighs in on the ongoing partnership between WWE and TNA Wrestling.
fullText:
Over the past two years, WWE and TNA Wrestling have gradually strengthened their professional relationship, so much so that a long-term partnership was formally inked in January 2025. Through it, TNA stars such as Frankie Kazarian have been able to appear on WWE programming, while "WWE NXT" talents have returned the favor with a number of outings in TNA. On a recent edition of¬†"Two Man Power Trip," Kazarian weighed in on the ongoing partnership.

"It's been beneficial, that goes without saying, for us, and I think it's been beneficial for NXT," he said. "A lot of those guys that come up in that system, they learn what WWE wants to teach them, which is their way of doing television and matches and all that. Coming to TNA, they get kind of a different taste. It's a bit looser, a lot more freedom when it comes to promos and stuff. There's a little bit less micromanagement, so it's really cool for them to see that side of it.

"For me, all the stuff I've been able to do at NXT last year, I had a blast," he continued. "They really treated me great. They rolled out the red carpet for me. It was cool just to be part of that crossover."

In Kazarian's case, he has wrestled for "NXT" on two occasions, the latest of which saw him and three other TNA men ‚Äî Moose, Mike Santana, and Leon Slater ‚Äî defeated four of "NXT's" top talents in a Survivor Series-style match in October. Months before that, Kazarian made his "NXT" debut in a battle royal to determine the number one contender to the NXT Championship.

If you use any of the quotes in this article, please credit "Two Man Power Trip" with a h/t to Wrestling Inc. for the transcription.
