title: Russian air attack on Ukraine knocks out power for millions
description: Russia launched another vast attack on Ukraine's energy system in the small hours of Saturday, rocking Kyiv with explosions throughout the night and leaving 1.2
fullText:
Jan 24 (Reuters) - Russia launched another vast attack on Ukraine's energy system in the small hours of Saturday, rocking Kyiv with explosions throughout the night and leaving ‚Äã1.2 million properties without power countrywide.

Nearly 6,000 buildings in the capital were left without heating ‚Äåon Saturday morning as temperatures hovered around -10 degrees Celsius (14 F). Many residents' apartments were already freezing cold from disruption to the ‚Äåcity's centralised heat distribution system following previous attacks.

Moscow carried out the strikes as trilateral, U.S.-brokered talks between Russia and Ukraine continued into a second day in the UAE, with no sign of compromise on Friday.

Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko said one person was killed in the capital city and four injured, including three being treated ‚Å†in hospital, while 19 people including ‚Äåa child were wounded in Ukraine's second city, Kharkiv.

Russia, which has pummelled Ukraine's power grid since its full-scale invasion in 2022, is conducting its heaviest bombardment campaign ‚Äçon energy facilities this winter, leaving people across Ukraine with only a few hours of power a day and some without heat or water.

Over 800,000 people in the capital and another 400,000 in the northern region of Chernihiv ‚Äãwere without power after the latest attacks, Deputy Prime Minister Oleksiy Kuleba said.

Ukraine's air force said ‚ÄåRussia had unleashed 375 drones and 21 missiles, including two of its rarely deployed Tsirkon ballistic missiles, in its overnight attack.

The sky over Kyiv was lit up by regular orange flashes as air defences fired on missiles and drones descending on the capital, with loud booms echoing around the city's tall buildings.

Tymur Tkachenko, head of Kyiv's military administration, reported strikes in at least four districts. A medical facility was ‚Å†among the buildings damaged.

Before Saturday, Kyiv had already endured two ‚Äãmass overnight attacks since the New Year that have knocked ‚Äãout power and heating to hundreds of residential buildings.

Emergency workers were still engaged in restoring services to residents that had been knocked out by those attacks, and Klitschko said ‚Äçmany of the buildings ‚Å†that had lost heating on Saturday had only recently had it restored.

In Kharkiv, a frequent target 30 km (18 miles) from the Russian border and much closer to eastern battlefronts, Mayor Ihor ‚Å†Terekhov said 25 drones had hit several districts.

Writing on Telegram, Terekhov said the drones had struck a dormitory for displaced people ‚Äåand two medical facilities including a maternity hospital.

title: Ice storm warning: Knoxville and East Tennessee get new storm forecast
description: The National Weather Service issued an ice storm warning. Here's what it means and how it differs from snowstorm alerts.
fullText:
An ice storm warning is in place for Knoxville and parts of East Tennessee.

While the rest of the Volunteer State is under a winter storm warning, East Tennessee is bracing for crippling ice.

The ice storm warning runs from 1 p.m. Saturday, Jan. 24, through 7 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 25, according to the National Weather Service.

It is in place for the following counties: Anderson, Bledsoe, Bradley, Cherokee, Clay, Hamilton, Jefferson, Knox, Loudon, Marion, McMinn, Meigs, Rhea, Roane and Sequatchie.

Northeast Tennessee has a winter storm warning for the following counties: Campbell, Claiborne, Grainger, Hamblen, Hancock, Hawkins, Morgan, Scott, Sullivan and Union.

Here's what to know about the warnings and how to stay safe.

An ice storm warning is issued when an area may receive a quarter-inch or more of ice accumulation, according to the National Weather Service.

"Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages," the weather service warned.

A winter weather advisory has been issued for the Great Smoky Mountains, where mixed precipitation of snow and sleet is expected.

The warning is in effect from 1 p.m. Saturday, Jan. 24, to 7 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 25.

"Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel will be hazardous. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches," the weather service warned.

The mountaintops have a high wind warning from 7 p.m. Saturday to 7 p.m. Sunday. Widespread power outages are expected.

A winter storm watch indicates severe weather is on the way. The watch will be issued at least 24 hours before a storm that has a risk of being hazardous, according to the National Weather Service. The storm's occurrence, location or timing may be uncertain under a watch.

A watch will normally be upgraded to either a warning or an advisory, depending on how a storm develops.

A winter storm warning means that a storm is imminent. Warnings are issued for a significant winter weather event, including snow, ice, sleet or blowing snow ‚Äí or a combination of these hazards, according to the National Weather Service.

If a winter storm warning is issued, it's best to stay off the roads.

A winter storm advisory means the storm is happening, but the winter weather storm dangers are limited. Be prepared for winter driving conditions and possible travel difficulties. Use caution when driving.

There are things that you can do to prepare yourself, your car and your home for the upcoming winter weather.

Make sure that you have food, extra water and warm clothes ahead of a storm in case the ice or snow causes a power outage, according to the Red Cross. It's also helpful to have a snow shovel and salt on hand for your driveway and sidewalks.

Also, consider filling up your car with gas before a snowstorm. Keep a blanket, an emergency kit and warm clothes in your car in case you get stuck on the side of the road, according to the Red Cross.

There's still much uncertainty about the details of the expected winter storm this weekend. Regardless, now is the time to start preparing. pic.twitter.com/CwDRlQLVXV

‚Äî NWS Morristown (@NWSMorristown) January 21, 2026

Allison Kiehl covers trending and breaking news from Knoxville for the Tennessee Connect Team. Email: allison.kiehl@knoxnews.com

Support strong local journalism and unlock premium perks at¬†knoxnews.com/subscribe.

This article originally appeared on Knoxville News Sentinel: Knoxville snow forecast: Ice storm warning in place for East Tennessee

title: ICE Barbie Refuses to Dump Alleged Lover Who Was Vetoed by Trump
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem is keeping her de facto chief of staff for another year despite President Donald Trump refusing to make the arrangement official‚Äîor long term. Corey Lewandowski has emerged as the second most powerful person at the Department of Homeland Security after Noem herself, despite being classified as an unpaid special government employee who can only work 130 days per calendar year. He was accused last year of vastly undercounting his work hours, prompting the Wh
fullText:
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem is keeping her de facto chief of staff for another year despite President Donald Trump refusing to make the arrangement official‚Äîor long term.

Corey Lewandowski has emerged as the second most powerful person at the Department of Homeland Security after Noem herself, despite being classified as an unpaid special government employee who can only work 130 days per calendar year.

He was accused last year of vastly undercounting his work hours, prompting the White House to begin monitoring his work schedule.

He stayed in the role throughout 2025, and has now been rehired for 2026, Axios reported.

The 54-year-old secretary, dubbed ‚ÄúICE Barbie‚Äù by the Daily Beast for her habit of cosplaying as an immigration agent, and Lewandowski, 52, are both married to other people but have long been rumored to be having an affair described by one Trump administration official as the ‚Äúworst-kept secret‚Äù in Washington, D.C.

Both have denied being romantically involved, but the rumors have been so persistent that Trump refused to let Lewandowski serve as Noem‚Äôs official chief of staff.

Lewandowski has nevertheless rarely left Noem‚Äôs side since she became secretary, amassing a staggering amount of power at DHS in the process.

According to multiple reports, he travels with Noem to meet with world leaders, participates in high-level policy meetings, advises the secretary on personnel decisions, arranges contractor meetings, reviews contracts, and schedules the secretary‚Äôs meetings with DHS officials and lobbyists.

‚ÄúKristi is the face of DHS. Corey is the brains. He gets things done,‚Äù a senior administration official told Axios.

Last week, an Axios reporter spotted Lewandowski standing at a gate at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport, where he was apparently discussing DHS vendor contracts loudly on the phone. The former Trump campaign chief specifically mentioned data company Palantir as well as a drone program, according to the outlet.

A DHS spokesperson told Axios that Palantir has had a contract with the U.S. government for 14 years but that Lewandowski had never worked with Palantir and was not involved in the company‚Äôs government contract.

Last year, however, The Wall Street Journal reported that Lewandowski had arranged for Noem to meet with Palantir and had told DHS officials to give the company additional work. Weeks later, DHS updated an existing contract to give Palantir an additional $29.9 million.

The Daily Beast has reached out to Lewandowski and DHS for comment.

As a special government employee, Lewandowski is allowed to maintain all of his private business interests and does not have to file a public financial disclosure form.

He is still subject to federal conflict of interest laws, but he refuses to say how he makes money, according to Axios.

He also remains close to the president, having managed Trump‚Äôs presidential campaign for part of the 2016 election cycle and later serving as an adviser to the Trump 2024 team.

‚ÄúNo one can really control Corey,‚Äù a senior official told Axios.

title: Hiker Kept Climbing California Mountain After Companion Turned Back for Safety. He Was Found Dead the Next Day
description: The unidentified hiker was reported missing after failing to descend Mount Whitney on Monday, Jan. 18
fullText:
A hiker has been found dead after attempting to climb Mount Whitney in California despite their companion turning back

At around 3:30 p.m. on Sunday, ‚Äúwhile near the 12,500-foot elevation, one hiker determined it was safest to turn around and descend," per a release from a local search & rescue group, though the second hiker continued on and ultimately died

‚ÄúAfter a thorough search, the subject was located on the north face of Mount Whitney, below the ‚ÄúFinal 400‚Äù on the Mountaineers Route, and was confirmed deceased,‚Äù officials said. They did not reveal the person's identity

A hiker has been found dead after attempting to climb Mount Whitney in California despite their companion turning back.

On Wednesday, Jan. 21, the Inyo County Search & Rescue confirmed in a post on Facebook that they received a report about a missing hiker on Monday.

Officials said the individual began hiking with another person at around 11:30 p.m. on Saturday and into the next day.

However, at around 3:30 p.m. local time on Sunday, ‚Äúwhile near the 12,500-foot elevation, one hiker determined it was safest to turn around and descend.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe second hiker continued ascending toward the summit,‚Äù the release read. ‚ÄúWhen the second hiker failed to return by the following morning, the reporting party contacted the Inyo County Sheriff‚Äôs Office, and a SAR response was initiated.‚Äù

Never miss a story ‚Äî 

The rescue operation involved a team of six rescuers and the California Highway Patrol Inland Division helicopter (H-82), which departed from Lone Pine.

When the helicopter arrived at Mount Whitney at around 2:00 p.m., a ‚Äúrescuer was inserted with the flight crew to conduct an aerial search.‚Äù

‚ÄúAfter a thorough search, the subject was located on the north face of Mount Whitney, below the ‚ÄúFinal 400‚Äù on the Mountaineers Route, and was confirmed deceased,‚Äù officials said. They did not reveal the person's identity.

The rescuers then returned to Lone Pine just before 6:00 p.m.

‚ÄúThe incident occurred within Tulare County jurisdiction, and proper notification was made to the Tulare County Sheriff's Office,‚Äù Inyo County Search & Rescue continued.

The news comes after the body of a missing 21-year-old hiker was recovered on Mount Whitney, Los Angeles Times reported.

PEOPLE also previously reported that a father of two died after falling from a trail while climbing Mount Whitney in October.

In their recent statement, the Inyo County Search & Rescue said the ‚Äúrecent fatalities on Mount Whitney and Mount Baldy, serves as a reminder that winter ascents are serious mountaineering endeavors, not hikes.‚Äù

‚ÄúWinter conditions leave little margin for error, and the consequences can be severe,‚Äù they added. ‚ÄúAdditionally, many fatalities occur when individuals travel solo or when groups separate.‚Äù

They went on to say that the safety concerns of a person in a group ‚Äú should be taken seriously.‚Äù

‚ÄúFatigue is also a critical contributing factor,‚Äù they added. ‚ÄúExtended periods of exertion negatively impact decision-making and increase the likelihood of missteps and falls. Knowing when to turn around can save lives."

The statement from rescuers concluded, ‚ÄúPlease be respectful in your comments. The victim‚Äôs family and friends may be following this post, and some comments may be hurtful. Thank you!‚Äù

Mount Whitney is the tallest mountain in the contiguous U.S., according to the National Park Service‚Äôs website. The elevation at the summit is reported to be 14,505 feet.

title: Grant Cardone: A home is a ‚Äòterrible investment‚Äô since it ‚Äòain‚Äôt your house.‚Äô How to tap real estate without a mortgage
description: You don't have to make a 30-year commitment to get into real estate.
fullText:
Moneywise and Yahoo Finance LLC may earn commission or revenue through links in the content below.

Given how much real estate prices have soared in America, many homeowners may be feeling richer than ever. But real estate mogul Grant Cardone says your house isn‚Äôt a smart investment ‚Äî far from it.

In a January interview with podcaster Sean Kelly, Cardone said, ‚Äúa house is not something that people should be buying. They should rent (1).‚Äù

Thanks to Jeff Bezos, you can now become a landlord for as little as $100 ‚Äî and no, you don't have to deal with tenants or fix freezers. Here's how

Get early access to privately-held AI companies with Fundrise Venture Capital for as little as $10. Join 350,000+ investors today

Dave Ramsey warns nearly 50% of Americans are making 1 big Social Security mistake ‚Äî here‚Äôs what it is and 3 simple steps to fix it ASAP

That may seem ironic coming from someone known for investing in residential real estate. But it‚Äôs not the first time Cardone has tackled this issue, saying in a separate video on TikTok that buying a home ‚Äúis a terrible investment (2).‚Äù

He was quick to explain why: ‚Äú[A home] doesn‚Äôt [give] cash flow. You don't get big tax write-offs because of it. You have no leverage. You're living in it. You're paying for it. You never own it. Even when the loan is paid, you don't own it. You still got to pay property taxes, still got to insure, still got to maintain it.‚Äù

When you buy a home to live in, it‚Äôs true that it won‚Äôt necessarily generate any cash flow. And even once the mortgage is paid off, there are still ongoing costs: property taxes, insurance premiums, repairs and maintenance. And they can add up fast.

The median monthly ownership costs for U.S. homeowners with a mortgage increased by around 4% from 2024 to 2025, based on data from the U.S. Census Bureau (3). In a related press release, census data revealed that homeowners with a mortgage are spending more than 20% of their income on additional homeownership costs.

Cardone suggests a simple reason that these costs are ignored, alongside the downsides of homeownership.

‚ÄúPeople get emotional about their house ‚Äî ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs my house!‚Äô‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt ain‚Äôt your house. You're a partner in this house with the state.‚Äù

Cardone‚Äôs suggestion is simple: ‚ÄúNever buy a house, rent where you live.‚Äù

But that doesn‚Äôt mean he‚Äôs against real estate entirely.

‚ÄúI'm not saying ‚Äòdon't own real estate,‚Äô‚Äù he clarified. ‚ÄúI'm saying live in a house and pay rent. Take all the money that you would have spent on that house and invest in real estate that [has] cash flows ‚Äî that pays you every month.‚Äù

title: Trump administration pushes out official whose unit banned Chinese vehicles, sources say
description: The Trump administration has pushed out a Commerce Department official whose office effectively barred nearly all Chinese cars from the U.S.
fullText:
Jan 23 (Reuters) - The Trump administration has pushed out a Commerce Department official ‚Äãwhose office effectively barred nearly all Chinese cars from ‚Äåthe U.S. market for national security reasons, according to people familiar with the matter.

Elizabeth "Liz" Cannon ‚Äåhas resigned as executive director for Information and Communications Technology and Services (ICTS), an office created in 2022 to investigate threats to the supply chain from foreign adversaries, the people said.

News of ‚Å†Cannon's impending departure comes ‚Äåshortly after the department dropped a plan to impose restrictions on Chinese drones despite the risk that ‚ÄçU.S. adversaries might remotely access and manipulate the devices, exposing sensitive U.S. data.

The office, which falls under the department's Bureau of Industry and ‚ÄãSecurity (BIS), also has not issued regulations to address concerns ‚Äåabout medium and heavy-duty truck exports. It finalized rules a year ago under then-president Joe Biden that effectively barred Chinese passenger vehicles.

‚ÄúBIS is committed to using its ICTS authorities to address national security risks from foreign technology," a spokesperson for the ‚Å†bureau said in a statement Friday. "Recent staffing ‚Äãchanges at the ICTS Office will ‚Äãstrengthen the Office and ensure that it continues to deliver for the American people.‚Äù

The sources said that, ‚Äçhad she not ‚Å†resigned, Cannon would have been reassigned, and that the new administration plans to put a political appointee in the ‚Å†post. Her last day is expected to be February 20, two people ‚Äåsaid.

title: Mamdani roasted for ‚Äòidiotic and moronic‚Äô warning on NYC snowstorm
description: "That tells you absolutely nothing."
fullText:
For some, Mayor Zohran Mamdani has already failed when it comes to what is traditionally a big test for New York City mayors: dealing with a major snowstorm.

The new mayor is getting roasted online after issuing a warning about the massive snow event that‚Äôs coming this weekend, the New York Post reported.

‚ÄúNYC is forecasted to get 3‚Äì16 inches of snow this weekend. And we‚Äôre ready,‚Äù Mamdani wrote on X on Thursday afternoon as part of a post on the city‚Äôs prep for the storm.

NYC is forecasted to get 3‚Äì16 inches of snow this weekend. And we‚Äôre ready.

We‚Äôll issue a Code Blue later today, and outreach workers will ramp up efforts to connect unhoused New Yorkers to safe shelter.

Tomorrow, we'll begin pre-snow treatment, brining highways and major‚Ä¶

‚Äî Mayor Zohran Kwame Mamdani (@NYCMayor) January 22, 2026

‚Äú3-16, way to narrow down the forecast,‚Äù one user on X commented.

‚ÄúSaying that NYC is going to get between 3 and 16 inches of snow is nonsense,‚Äù another said. ‚ÄúThat tells you absolutely nothing. Citing numbers with a probability range of 5% to 95% is idiotic and moronic.‚Äù

‚ÄúMaybe they forgot the 1 in front of the 3? Idk?‚Äù said another snarky commenter.

The Post said that the five boroughs were already under a winter storm watch, issued by the National Weather Service, calling for 6-12 inches of snow when Mamdani posted his statement.

Current forecasts call for anywhere from 8-14 inches of snow to fall on the city this weekend.

New York City mayors in the past have been lambasted for poor reactions to snowstorms.

Mayor Bill de Blasio was scorched in 2014 when Islanders railed that plows and salters were slow to the rescue after a big snowstorm.

Mayor John Lindsay got clobbered when the city was slow to react to a 1969 snowstorm.

And Mayor Michael Bloomberg took a pounding when the city flubbed the 2010 Christmas blizzard.

That was the year that Bloomberg pushed back against critics who said that the city was slow to react to the storm, saying that ‚ÄúThe city is going fine. Broadway shows were full last night.‚Äù

title: Suns HC Drops Concerning Devin Booker Injury Update After Phoenix Suffers Double Blow
description: If there was one word to summarize the Phoenix Suns‚Äô season, ‚Äúunlucky‚Äù might just be it. That‚Äôs the theme of Jordan Ott‚Äôs post-game remarks too.
fullText:
If there was one word to summarize the Phoenix Suns‚Äô season, ‚Äúunlucky‚Äù might just be it. That‚Äôs the theme of Jordan Ott‚Äôs post-game remarks too. In his first year as the Suns‚Äô head coach, he‚Äôs not had a complete rotation because of injuries. After tonight‚Äôs 110-103 loss against the Hawks, Ott faces the prospect of his team being even more shorthanded of his explosive scorers, Devin Booker and Jalen Green.

He barely had Jalen Green back for a second game after a 33-game absence. He came off the bench for five minutes and had to limp back to the locker room. He was ruled out for the rest of the game.

Ott had no update on his status after the game. ‚ÄúJust same with Jalen. Just felt a little tightness, just for precautionary reasons took him out. Didn‚Äôt come back‚Ä¶‚Äù

This was the last game on a six-game road trip for the Suns. Ott said that they plan to assess Green once they‚Äôre back in Phoenix. But that wasn‚Äôt all.

Once more, injuries decimated the Suns before the Hawks could. Even Devin Booker had an injury scare. After Green‚Äôs exit, Book had a run-in with Hawks forward Onyeka Okongwu. They got tied up and Booker was in pain on the floor.

Ott said, ‚ÄúObviously you saw what happened to Book, right ankle, rolled it on someone else‚Äôs foot. Pretty unlucky. So, we‚Äôll just have to take a look when we get back to Phoenix.‚Äù

For now an update on Green and Booker are pending their return to Phoenix. But it‚Äôs not looking great for the team.

title: Chiefs Threaten Kansas Exit Over $3 Billion Dispute as Clark Hunt & Ownership Demand a ‚ÄòLandlord‚Äô for New Stadium
description: The future of the Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô new home stadium is in jeopardy after a recent committee meeting involving Kansas lawmakers. The Chiefs announced plans for a new $3 billion domed stadium in December, where they proposed public ownership of the arena, as a significant percentage of the funding would be secured through sales tax revenue (STAR) bonds.
fullText:
The future of the Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô new home stadium is in jeopardy after a recent committee meeting involving Kansas lawmakers. The Chiefs announced plans for a new $3 billion domed stadium in December, where they proposed public ownership of the arena, as a significant percentage of the funding would be secured through sales tax revenue (STAR) bonds.

Hence, when questions were raised about why the stadium wasn‚Äôt privately owned, Chiefs attorney Korb Maxwell issued a statement confirming that, without public ownership, the proposal wouldn‚Äôt make sense for the franchise.

‚ÄúIf that (stadium) is not owned by a sports authority, if that is owned in private hands, then, if you would have $1.8 billion of STAR bonds come into that development, that would all be federally income taxed,‚Äù Maxwell said, as per the Kansas City Business Journal. ‚ÄúAnd so you would take, then, 45% of the dollars that came in and roughly ship that to Washington, D.C. ‚Ä¶ That would blow a huge hole in the budget for this project and, frankly, would not allow it to move forward.‚Äù

As explained by Korb Maxwell, private ownership would entail that the $1.8 billion in sales tax revenue (STAR) bonds could not be issued for the Chiefs‚Äô stadium on a tax-exempt basis. This would lead to a massive hit on the franchise‚Äôs budget for the stadium and, hence, would push the Chiefs to move away from their proposed plan.

These questions about public ownership of the stadium stem from the possibility of what would happen if the Kansas City Chiefs, who will be taking care of the arena, decide to leave. Responding to these concerns, the Chiefs‚Äô attorney reiterated the franchise‚Äôs long-term plans for the stadium.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre absolutely doing this and planning this as the long, long-term home for the Kansas City Chiefs for (multiple) generations,‚Äù Maxwell said, as per theKansas City Business Journal.

With this statement, the Chiefs seem adamant about securing public ownership for their new stadium, as they believe this venture will be prosperous for the state of Kansas.

As plans for the new Kansas City Chiefs stadium were unveiled, team owner Clark Hunt shared why this decision to move from Arrowhead was taken. In his statement, Hunt explained how this new project will significantly benefit the fans and the state of Kansas.

‚ÄúWe made a decision as a family that this was the right opportunity and the best for the organization for several reasons,‚Äù Hunt said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about the fans. My dad [Lamar Hunt, who founded the franchise] was always about the fans and thinking about the future.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis will give Chiefs Kingdom a state-of-the-art facility for multiple generations, a building that can last for at least 50 or 60 years. We believe it‚Äôs the best thing for the region. It will give Kansas City the opportunity to bid on events that we can‚Äôt host right now, like the Super Bowl, the College Football Playoff, and the NCAA Final Fours.‚Äù

As the Chiefs navigate the complex financing structure for their proposed $3 billion domed stadium, the franchise‚Äôs commitment to public ownership appears non-negotiable due to federal tax implications. Whether Kansas lawmakers will approve the necessary STAR bonds remains to be seen, but the Hunt family has made clear its vision extends generations into the future.

The post Chiefs Threaten Kansas Exit Over $3 Billion Dispute as Clark Hunt & Ownership Demand a ‚ÄòLandlord‚Äô for New Stadium appeared first on EssentiallySports.

title: Geno Auriemma‚Äôs Latest Azzi Fudd, Sarah Strong Decision Has March Written All Over It
description: Another game, another win! The No. 1-ranked UConn Huskies rolled past the Georgetown Hoyas 83‚Äì42, tightening their grip on Big East play once again.
fullText:
Another game, another win! The No. 1-ranked UConn Huskies rolled past the Georgetown Hoyas 83‚Äì42, tightening their grip on Big East play once again. But what caught everyone‚Äôs eye wasn‚Äôt the lopsided score; it was an in-game decision by head coach Geno Auriemma that offered a clear preview of how UConn will look in March.

For the first time in the Huskies‚Äô conference play, Auriemma kept Azzi Fudd and Sarah Strong on the floor to begin the fourth quarter, despite UConn holding a comfortable lead. The Huskies immediately went on to respond with a 10‚Äì0 run, powered by four different scorers, erasing any thought of a late Georgetown push and turning the final period into another statement. But why the sudden change of heart?

In a post-game interview, the head coach explained that the move had far less to do with the Hoyas and everything to do with preparation.

‚ÄúPart of it is I‚Äôm trying to get them around the 30-minute mark every game,‚Äù Geno Auriemma said. ‚ÄúI just think if I don‚Äôt, I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm being fair to them, and also getting them ready for the postseason as well. So that was number one. Number two, let them play themselves out. Shots weren‚Äôt going in for them. And you could see that they were getting a little bit frustrated, and I thought if I can just give them a couple more minutes to find their way out of it for a little bit, that‚Äôs mainly it. I mean, it still came down to 30-minutes even though they played in the fourth quarter a little bit.‚Äù

And both of these players made sure to make the most of their presence on the court in the final quarter. Strong finished with a game-high 25 points as she continues her steady rise as a reliable scoring option. On the other hand, Fudd added another 19 points in what was her final collegiate appearance in front of a hometown crowd in Washington, D.C.

However, the night didn‚Äôt start smoothly for Fudd. She missed her first seven attempts from beyond the arc as the Huskies opened just 1-for-13 from deep. But neither she nor Strong pressed. Once the Huskies found their rhythm, the two combined to flip the game entirely, each knocking down key shots as UConn closed the first half on a decisive run and carried a 51‚Äì20 lead into the break.

As the 2025‚Äì26 NCAA season moves forward, the Huskies are now at 20-0 overall and 10-0 in the Big East Conference. The only team that even came close to securing a win over them was the Michigan Wolverines, where they ended the game at 72-69. On the scoresheet, Sarah Strong leads the team on an individual level with the most points (19), most rebounds (8.3), most steals (3.7), and most blocks (1.6). However, when it comes to assists, KK Arnold holds that spot with 4.6 per game.

As a team, the Huskies offensively average 89.8 points per game, while holding their opponents to just 51 points.

For their next game, they will lock horns with the Seton Hall Pirates on January 24th. A game predicted to be in favor of the Huskies with 98.9% by ESPN. Following that, they will play against:

The Xavier Musketeers on January 28th.

The No. 17 Tennessee Lady Volunteers on February 1st.

The DePaul Blue Demons on February 4th.

With the stretch ahead gradually getting tougher, the UConn Huskies now enter the part of the season where, more than margins, what will matter is the habits they are building. And if the game against the Hoyas was any indication, trusting his core, extending minutes, and letting his best players work through discomfort rather than shielding them with the scoreboard will be the very approach Geno Auriemma will lean on in March.

The post Geno Auriemma‚Äôs Latest Azzi Fudd, Sarah Strong Decision Has March Written All Over It appeared first on EssentiallySports.

title: This teen? He's a pro, he flew private and he's leading on Tour | Weekend 9
description: Here are nine nuggets for your weekend.
fullText:
Welcome! Where are you, you ask. I'm calling this the Weekend 9. Think of it as a spot to warm up for Friday, Saturday and Sunday. We'll have thoughts. We'll have tips. We'll have tweets. But just nine in all, though sometimes maybe more and sometimes maybe less. As for who I am? The paragraphs below tell some of the story. I can be reached at nick.piastowski@golf.com.

If you're reading this report, you're probably being encircled by snow, or the cold, or by pics from your pals in much calmer climates, so let's start with something warm and bright, such as this:

"Yeah, I love what I do. I love to play golf."

That's good. That was from Blades Brown, who's now three-fourths of the way through a¬† maybe-never-been-done-before playing attempt - and halfway home to something even more incredible. Here are your facts: On Sunday, he teed off at the the Bahamas Great Abaco Classic on the Korn Ferry Tour, where he's a member, then he played Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday - before heading to the PGA Tour's American Express, a tournament that runs Thursday through Sunday and invited Brown to play on a sponsor exemption. Add that all up, and you get this:

Brown could play eight consecutive days of PGA Tour-level golf, and as far as anyone can tell, he'd be the first to do so.

Which, come Sunday night, might be just a cute trivia answer, because dude might win the thing. Please stay with us here.

The story starts 18 years ago, which is also when Brown did. Eighteen is Brown age, making him one of professional golf's youngest players - and there was natural curiosity when, a year ago, he started his pro career at the American Express on a sponsor exemption. How would the then-17-year-old play? How would he look away from the play? The first sentence of a story from Larry Bohannan, a writer from the nearby Palm Springs Desert Sun, summed it up this way:

For three days, Blades Brown was the story of The American Express, with the 17-year-old making birdies and thrilling galleries in his professional debut.

Brown was personable. Ahead of the AmEx, he talked about dad and mom, who played in the WNBA and hit the league's first 3-pointer. He talked about wanting to dunk. Brown then opened with a 72, then shot a 64, which, according to GOLF.com contributor Justin Ray, was the lowest score in a PGA Tour round by a player under the age of 18 in the last 40 years. On his third day at the American Express - the event plays three rounds -¬†Brown stumbled to a 74 and he missed the cut, but he hung around for interviews, including the one below, which was shown live on Golf Channel:

"Golf is a weird and funny game ‚Ä¶ but I'm going to keep my head up."

Despite missing the cut, 17-year-old Blades Brown keeps a positive mindset after his first professional start @TheAmExGolf. pic.twitter.com/XhEpNiMvG2

‚Äî PGA TOUR (@PGATOUR) January 18, 2025

After all that, the folks at American Express invited him back. And the eight-day plan became a possibility. Brown earned the Korn Ferry spot through his full-time status on the tour (gained by finishing in the top 75 last year on the circuit's season-long points standings). He also picked up a ride between the Bahamas and the West Coast. Last May, he played in the PGA Tour's Myrtle Beach Classic, where he was given five hours of flight time by event sponsor and private jet company ONEFight by finishing in the top 50 - and he's cashed it in. His schedule between the tournaments looked like this:

‚Äì Finished the final round at the Abaco Club on Wednesday afternoon

‚Äì Drove from the course to Thompson International Airport in the Bahamas, where the private jet took off at 4 p.m. Eastern ("It was awesome," Brown said Thursday. "My second time ever flying private. It was beautiful.")

‚Äì Landed at 6:30 p.m. Pacific at Palm Springs International Airport

‚Äì Got out to PGA West to warm up and roll some putts. ("I mean, it was blowing 30 the entire way," Brown said, "and then you get here and then it‚Äôs perfect.")

But could he, you know, play eight straight days? He'd have to make a pair of cuts, too - and he most certainly will, barring the unforeseen, after a Friday at the AmEx few saw coming.

Brown birdied his first hole (the 10th at the Nicklaus Tournament Course). And eagled the second. And birdied the third. And the fourth. And the fifth. And the sixth. And the seventh. He was eight-under - through seven. After a pair of pars, he finished his first nine with a 28. Folks start whispering then. And Brown kept balling. He birdied his 11th hole. And 13th. And 14th. And 15th. He was 12-under on the par-72 - with three holes left to shoot 59. Or 58. Or 57.

Brown parred out. On 18, after a wedge that dropped to within a few feet of the hole, his birdie attempt slid past its right side. "I was thinking, OK, maybe just a little outside right edge," he said. "Unfortunately, it didn‚Äôt break." Still, a 60 is a 60. That tied for the day's best score.

And, through two rounds, Brown is tied for the lead with someone who's seemingly always around the top: world No. 1 Scottie Scheffler. Much can happen from here to Sunday, of course, then again, much already has, and here Brown is. Should he win, he'd be the second-youngest ever to do so on the PGA Tour, according to the PGA Tour record books. (The youngest was Charles Kocsis, who, at 18 years, 6 months, 9 days, won the 1931 Michigan Open; Brown turns 19 in May.)

But again, that's getting ahead of things.

And Friday night, Brown was thinking of other things.

"I‚Äôm going to go take a nap after this," he said, "and probably get some food."

Let's see if we can find eight more items for the Weekend 9.

2. The PGA Tour social media team captured Brown's trip from the Bahamas to California, and you can watch it below.

On Wednesday afternoon, 18-year-old Blades Brown completed the final round @KornFerryTour@BahamasKFTour at The Abaco Club.

On Thursday morning, he teed it up on TOUR @TheAmExGolf, roughly 2,500 miles west ‚Ä¶ and he carded a bogey-free 67

‚Äî PGA TOUR (@PGATOUR) January 23, 2026

3. Golf Channel's Brentley Romine also shared this:

If Blades Brown makes the cut Saturday at The American Express, he's believed to be the first player, at least in modern history, to play eight competitive rounds between the PGA and Korn Ferry tours in as many days.

However, I was mistaken in thinking that no other player has‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/S6jM9D44NB

‚Äî Brentley Romine (@BrentleyGC) January 23, 2026

4. This week, I talked to University of Mississippi golf coach Chris Malloy, whose star player, Michael La Sasso, left the Rebels in order to sign a deal from LIV Golf, backed by the Saudi Arabia Public Investment Fund. In doing so, La Sasso gave up a shot at PGA Tour-level golf through the Tour's university program, a chance to defend the NCAA title he won a year ago, and a tee time at this year's Masters, which was given to him through the NCAA victory.

I asked Malloy about the Masters invite and how much that played into his decision, and he said this, which I've been thinking about:

"You know, not as much as you would think. Mike was pretty good about thinking long term and not being as short-sighted. Certainly that hurt. I don't think he ever imagined himself saying, ‚ÄòNo, no, I'm not going to go play the Masters this year,' But I'll give him a lot of credit in that regard. Somebody his age going through all this, he really did a good job of thinking long term."

There's a lot to consider here, obviously¬† - and I'm curious about what you would do. Feel free to email me at nick.piastowski@golf.com.

5. The tweet below, from LIV's Graeme McDowell, was also interesting, as were the responses.

Hot take but LIV is a legitimate pathway for young potential superstars who can get paid to be mentored in their young careers by Tour greats and play a guaranteed schedule. The road to the PGA Tour is increasingly perilous and littered with great talent that never made it.

‚Äî Graeme McDowell (@Graeme_McDowell) January 20, 2026

6. Brooks Koepka returns to the PGA Tour next week, after four seasons with LIV. I think he'll be asked about his decision to leave.

7. This week, GOLF's Sean Zak profiled Tommy Fleetwood, and it's here where you must - must - read the entire story (which you can do here) and watch the entire YouTube video (which you can do here). Because there are nuggets like this:

The rep he was earning "was impossible to ignore," he says. Doubts crept in during the tensest moments, an affliction that never plagues the player in 40th place. But rather than coalesce into some unbeatable boogeyman, the close calls somehow reduced Fleetwood's fear of falling short - so long as he forced himself through a sick form of therapy. When it would have been natural to retreat and discreetly lick his wounds, he went straight to the media and rewired his perception of those negative experiences.

"If you're gonna take the highs, you have to take the hits as well," he says now. "I'm talking to myself when I'm doing those interviews. I knew that if I spoke straight away and said the right things - the things I wanna hear as well - that it was a really important part of the process for me."

Fleetwood's fearless vulnerability struck such a chord with PGA Tour staffers that, at their annual orientation for rookie players in November, they used his post-Travelers presser as a peak example of media relations. If some of Fleetwood's maxims - "Thoughts and feelings are the most natural things we have; you can't fight them" - seem straight out of a self-help manual, they very well might be. He works with sports psychologist Bob Rotella and rereads his books often.

Again, here is the story link, and here is the video link.

8. With snow storms approaching parts of the country, I thought that the tweet below was worth sharing.

ùóöùó¢ùóüùóô ùóúùó° ùóßùóõùóò ùó¶ùó°ùó¢ùó™? ùó¨ùó¢ùó® ùó¶ùóßùóúùóüùóü ùóñùóîùó°!

These are your options when there is snow or ice on the ground:

1. Treat the snow/ice as a loose impediment, which means you can physically move it just like you would move leaves or twigs. Just be careful not to cause‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/28xfJ1gTv7

9. This story here is good. Written by Bill Smith of techblog.com, it describes a mini-golf putter that straightens the face as you putt, should you need it.

He wanted a putter that'd give him a break from those frustrating times when he just can't quite put the ball in the hole despite his best efforts. From the surface, it appears to be a standard-looking club with a machined head and a lengthy shaft, but within it houses a beast of a high-torque brushless motor coupled via a driving shaft to a worm gearbox that allows it to rotate the head around a vertical axis. This configuration maintains the head steady at impact while allowing for extremely quick modifications mid-swing.

10. Let's do 10 items! Here's a rundown of golf on TV this weekend:

11. Let's do 11 items! The video below, from Bridgestone Golf, was good.

Tiger Woods‚Ä¶ just a normal guy.

title: Kevin Durant praises Houston‚Äôs poise after statement win at Detroit
description: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got a great coaching staff,‚Äù Kevin Durant says. ‚ÄúGreat training staff. They keep me ready. They keep me engaged, mentally and physically.‚Äù
fullText:
In one of their most impressive wins of the 2025-26 season, the Rockets wrapped up a difficult road back-to-back with Friday‚Äôs 111-104 victory (box score) at Detroit.

Houston (27-16) and Detroit (32-11) remain at No. 4 in the Western and Eastern Conference standings, respectively.

One night after committing eight turnovers in an overtime loss at Philadelphia ‚Äî including a very harmful one in the final minute of regulation ‚Äî Kevin Durant made amends and then some.

Playing 41 minutes despite the back-to-back, the future Hall of Famer finished with a game-high 32 points and 7 rebounds while making 11-of-19 shots (57.9%) and 5-of-11 from 3-point range.

‚ÄúWe just stayed poised,‚Äù said Durant, who is expected to earn his 16th career All-Star selection in the coming days.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got a great coaching staff,‚Äù added Durant, who ‚Äî at 37 years old ‚Äî ranks third in the NBA in minutes per game. ‚ÄúGreat training staff. They keep me ready. They keep me engaged, mentally and physically.‚Äù

16th 30-point game for @KDTrey5 this season üìà

Enjoying the little things. pic.twitter.com/CqzhD6e2lB

‚Äî Houston Rockets (@HoustonRockets) January 24, 2026

Other individual standouts included:

Jabari Smith Jr.: 11 points, 10 rebounds, 2 steals, 2 blocks; 5-of-9 shooting (55.6%), 1-of-3 on 3-pointers (33.3%)

Alperen Sengun: 19 points, 5 assists, 5 turnovers, 1 rebound; 6-of-11 shooting (54.5%), 7-of-10 on free throws (70.0%)

Amen Thompson: 15 points, 9 rebounds, 7 assists, 2 steals; 5-of-11 shooting (45.5%), 5-of-5 on free throws

Reed Sheppard: 18 points in 25 minutes; 6-of-15 shooting (40.0%), 5-of-5 on free throws

One night after shooting 12-of-24 on free throws (50.0%) in that loss to the 76ers, the Rockets went 24-of-30 (80.0%) in Detroit.

Thompson‚Äôs defense helped force Pistons star Cade Cunningham into a relatively inefficient night, as the All-Star guard finished with 12 points, 8 assists, and 6 turnovers while making 5-of-13 shots (38.5%) and missing all four of his 3-point attempts.

Tari Eason and Dorian Finney-Smith, who are each recovering from ankle injuries, sat out for maintenance purposes on night two of the back-to-back. Steven Adams remains sidelined indefinitely with a severe ankle sprain.

Next up for the Rockets is a return home to Toyota Center, where Houston is 15-3 this season. A two-game homestand begins Monday night versus Memphis, with tipoff versus the Grizzlies (18-25) scheduled for 7:00 p.m. Central.

The game will be televised regionally¬†on Space City Home Network and nationally via NBA League Pass.

More: As numbers rise, Rockets guard Amen Thompson turns heads around NBA

80 PERCENT FT SHOOTING 24-30 https://t.co/9hycvPyEjU

‚Äî Lachard Binkley (@BinkleyHoops) January 24, 2026

#Rockets beat the east leading Pistons 111-104

After the game Kevin Durant talked the intensity of the game, Amen facing his brother & Reed's impact@HoustonRockets I #AllFire pic.twitter.com/im7cvN4ni9

‚Äî Space City Home Network (@SpaceCityHN) January 24, 2026

Ime Udoka after the #Rockets 111-104 win over the Pistons@HoustonRockets I #AllFire pic.twitter.com/xDWqM1SnO4

‚Äî Space City Home Network (@SpaceCityHN) January 24, 2026

Amen 3‚É£ - Ausar 2‚É£ in the career head-to-head matchup of the Thompson Twins after the #Rockets 111-104 win over Detroit@HoustonRockets I #AllFire pic.twitter.com/CONnIr0xq0

‚Äî Space City Home Network (@SpaceCityHN) January 24, 2026

title: NBA schedule for January 24: Matchups and predicted winners
description: Saturday‚Äôs NBA table is packed with games that can swing the standings in both conferences. Some teams are trying to stop losing streaks, while others want to protect their home floors. From an early afternoon clash in Philadelphia to a‚Ä¶
fullText:
Saturday‚Äôs NBA table is packed with games that can swing the standings in both conferences. Some teams are trying to stop losing streaks, while others want to protect their home floors. From an early afternoon clash in Philadelphia to a late-night tip in Utah, every matchup brings its own pressure and story. Here is a clear look at the games and the teams most likely to come out on top. (Odds via CBS Sports)

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Spectrum Center, Charlotte

Washington enters on a rough stretch. The Wizards are 1-9 in their last 10 games and are allowing over 120 points per game in that span. Injuries have hit them hard, with Marvin Bagley III, Bilal Coulibaly, and Trae Young all sidelined. Scoring has become a problem without steady shooting and rebounding depth.

Charlotte is more stable at home and already beat Washington 126-109 in their last meeting. LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller continue to drive the offense, while Kon Knueppel is shooting over 48 percent from the field. The Hornets also defend better than Washington and force tougher shots. The double-digit spread reflects the gap in form and health. Charlotte should control this game from the second quarter onward.

Predicted winner: Charlotte Hornets

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Xfinity Mobile Arena, Philadelphia

Philadelphia comes off an overtime win against Houston, but their recent run is mixed at 5-5 in the last 10 games. Tyrese Maxey remains the main scoring threat, and Joel Embiid has been steady but not dominant in recent outings.

New York has struggled against teams above .500, yet their shooting profile gives them an edge here. The Knicks average nearly 15 made three-pointers per game, which is more than Philadelphia usually allows. Karl-Anthony Towns leads them with over 20 points and 11 rebounds per game. The narrow spread shows how close this matchup is. Shot-making from deep and rebounding could tilt it toward New York late.

Predicted winner: New York Knicks

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Target Center, Minneapolis

Minnesota has lost four straight games and has shown defensive leaks during that run. They still score well, averaging 120 points per game on the season, but stopping elite shooters remains a concern.

Golden State enters in better rhythm, winning six of its last ten. Stephen Curry continues to hit close to four threes per game, and the Warriors average over 122 points recently. The Timberwolves won the last meeting, but Curry scored 39 in that game. The plus points suggest a close contest. Experience and perimeter shooting give Golden State a real chance to steal this one on the road.

Predicted winner: Golden State Warriors

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Cleveland just beat Charlotte while holding them under 90 points. Donovan Mitchell led the way with 24 points, and the Cavs grabbed 60 rebounds in that game. Their defense forces turnovers and limits clean looks from three.

Orlando is coming off a heavy loss to Charlotte, allowing over 54 percent shooting. Paolo Banchero scored 23, but the Magic were outworked on both ends. Cleveland ranks sixth in scoring at over 119 points per game and also forces nearly 16 turnovers per night. With better form and more reliable shooting, Cleveland looks ready to edge Orlando even as a slight underdog.

Predicted winner: Cleveland Cavaliers

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Boston is strong on defense and sits second in the league in points allowed. Jaylen Brown just scored 30 against Indiana, while the team shot over 92 percent from the free-throw line. Their balance between scoring and defense keeps them steady on the road.

Chicago plays fast and ranks high in assists, but their defense gives up nearly 120 points per game. Coby White leads the offense, yet the Bulls allow too many open looks from outside. Boston‚Äôs ability to control pace and rebound should matter here. The small spread favors the more disciplined team. Boston should pull away late in the fourth.

Predicted winner: Boston Celtics

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: American Airlines Center, Dallas

Dallas has won three straight at home and has gone 7-3 in its last ten games. Cooper Flagg leads the team in scoring and rebounds, while Naji Marshall has added steady points in recent games. The Mavericks shoot well and protect home court better than their overall record suggests.

Los Angeles relies heavily on Luka Doncic, who is averaging over 33 points per game. The Lakers, however, are 4-6 in their last ten and have struggled with consistency. Dallas lost the first meeting, but this setting favors the home side. The points advantage and recent form make Dallas a solid pick.

Predicted winner: Dallas Mavericks

Date: Saturday, January 24, 2026

Venue: Delta Center, Salt Lake City

Utah has been leaky on defense but still scores well, averaging over 117 points per game in the last ten. Keyonte George leads the attack with more than 24 points per game. Home games have been more competitive for the Jazz.

Miami struggles on the road with an 8-15 away record. Their shooting has dipped below 44 percent in recent games, and they allow over 121 points per contest in the last ten. Utah‚Äôs pace and scoring should test Miami‚Äôs defense. The plus points suggest value on the home team. Utah has the edge in this matchup.

January 24 have some good games overall. Charlotte, Boston, and Cleveland look well positioned, while underdogs like Golden State, Dallas, and Utah have strong upset potential based on form and matchup stats. Fans should expect high-scoring games in Minnesota and Utah, with tighter contests in Philadelphia and Orlando.

The post NBA schedule for January 24: Matchups and predicted winners appeared first on The Big Lead.

title: Fan Focus: What Can Sunderland Expect From West Ham Today?
description: Ahead of today‚Äôs match, we spoke to West Ham fan Dan Woffenden of The West Ham Way website to find out more about them!
fullText:
Back in August Sunderland beat Graham Potter‚Äôs West Ham 3-0. What were the key factors that led to him losing his job just a month later?

An amalgamation of factors. I don‚Äôt think he was helped with the squad he inherited, weak in different areas all over the pitch and the summer window compounded that. The biggest problem at West Ham is the lack of planning, our transfer approach is scattergun and we are always reactive rather than proactive.

We always try to sign names rather than profiles and properly address positions that we need and we are now seeing it come back to bite us. On Potter, he just wasn‚Äôt the right fit and didn‚Äôt help himself, he was quite insipid and uninspiring and other than that win away at Forest we were really poor. We got some batterings, looked really open defensively and were conceding far too many goals, some of that hasn‚Äôt changed, but it was clear that if we kept Potter in position we would have certainly been cut a drift by now.

The man to replace him was ex-Wolves, Spurs and Nottingham Forest boss Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo ‚Äì how has he got on so far and how do fans view him?

It‚Äôs been a very mixed bag. In the first few games against Brentford & Leeds he experimented with the team, played some players out of position and we paid the price with two bad defeats that could be costly come the end of the season. He threw those games away.

We picked up a few good results after that and it looked like we turned a corner and were building some momentum, but to then go 10 Premier League games without a run was really difficult. A lot of those games came down to fine margins and not being good enough at both ends of the pitch, I think against Bournemouth away, Man United away, Brighton away, Villa at home we deserved to get more, but we dropped points and nothing was really going for us.

The alarm bells started ringing loudly after that defeat against Wolves, we were awful and it‚Äôs probably one of the worst performances I‚Äôve seen from a Premier League team let alone West Ham. We were weak, second to every ball and made some bad mistakes and it wasn‚Äôt acceptable. Against Forest we improved, we saw some fight and desire and were unlucky not to go on and win the game, once our second goal was ruled out the game just turned on its head and we collapsed and conceded two really soft goals.

So, I think myself and the majority of the fans see it as he has a poor squad that needs rebalancing and that he still is the right man for the job. I don‚Äôt see any other manager coming in and doing any better than Nuno and sacking him for me would just be us accepting relegation. Spurs was a big improvement, that first-half was our best under Nuno, we defended really well (for a change) and he mixed it up going for a 4-4-2 with the new strikers starting and it worked well and got us a big result, so I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll go into this game with confidence.

Currently 18th in the Premier League table, are you confident that the Hammers will avoid relegation?

No, I‚Äôm not. I know it‚Äôs only 5 points and it can swing in our favour with a few wins and results going our way, but I think the damage has already been done for me.

This transfer window was a big one for us to strengthen areas and bring in players that could help, but I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll do enough. We need a centre-back or two and the names we are linked with don‚Äôt bring me much confidence. Nuno is obsessed with wanting Adama Traore too who doesn‚Äôt move the needle for me.

I think Leeds are out of it, they are a good side, I can‚Äôt see Bournemouth getting sucked in either. The only side I think could is Crystal Palace, they‚Äôve lost some key players recently and aren‚Äôt on a good run, so the wheels could fall off there. With Forest, they will have to get to a point where they sacrifice the Europa League and prioritise the league. The next few weeks are key, they have Leeds away & Wolves at home, so by then we will have a better idea, but I do think it will be a shootout between us and Forest until the end of the season.

Ultimately, we‚Äôve got to focus on ourselves and pick up results and let the rest fall into place. We have some winnable games coming up, but whether we have the fight and quality to get through them is a different conversation, I have my doubts.

West Ham‚Äôs last league win at the London Stadium came back in November ‚Äì I imagine the atmosphere is quite difficult for the players at present?

Yes, it is. It‚Äôs not a great place to be at the minute and I think the players seem scared of playing there, we are much better away from home.

It just isn‚Äôt a football stadium, and when the chips are down it‚Äôs a very soulless place to play and I know there is another protest planned for this game, which Sunderland will have to try and feed off. I do think though better atmosphere comes with better performances, so hopefully the team give us something to shout about as we‚Äôve not had much there.

West Ham have spent ¬£47m on two strikers during the transfer window in Pablo and Taty Castellanos. Both unknown to most, what have they brought to the table?

Different qualities. I think first and foremost we have seen a bit of graft and energy from them which has helped the team. They were both Nuno‚Äôs choices through well-known agent Jorge Mendes. I was surprised during the links as our focus this window was on domestic based strikers who had experience of the Premier League, but I think that focus shifted when we discovered that our targets weren‚Äôt gettable.

I think they give us different options, at the start of the season we had Fullkrug and Wilson which wasn‚Äôt enough. With Taty, we‚Äôve been linked with him previously. He is a bit of a maverick which us West Ham fans love, he is capable of the spectacular, works hard and is good in the air. He‚Äôs good technically and will sometimes drop deep to link up play with Pablo running in-behind or them both interchanging. He scored his first goal for us against QPR which was a great header, so I‚Äôm excited to see more of him.

Pablo was a bit of an unknown, scored 10 goals in his first 13 games at Gil Vicente this season. He‚Äôs only 22 so it‚Äôs a big ask for a young player to come in and hit the ground running straight away in the situation we are in.

I‚Äôve been impressed so far though, it makes such a difference now Nuno has a target man in his team that can win duels and help us get up the pitch, which we didn‚Äôt have before. He started his first PL game against Spurs and did well, worked hard out of possession and played a key part in the first goal by forcing them into a mistake and linking up play well. He still looks a bit raw technically and patience is needed with that, but he will come good and showed during his time in Portugal that he is a clean finisher who gets into good areas. He‚Äôs not had many clear chances in front of goal yet, but when that comes I think he will most likely take it. I think he‚Äôs a good long-term fit for the striker role.

I read that Lucas Paqueta has requested a move back to Brazil ‚Äì do you think it‚Äôs likely he‚Äôll leave before the end of the transfer window?

I think so. He‚Äôs trying to engineer a move and is desperate to go back there, he will be missing for the game this weekend too which isn‚Äôt great.

It‚Äôs a bit of an ugly situation, he‚Äôs an important player for us and the club don‚Äôt want to let him go, but it gets to a point where you are better to cut your losses and reinvest the money elsewhere. The problem is, I don‚Äôt have faith in the club to reinvest the money wisely.

Next week will be decisive, we need to sell him before the end of the window, but Brazil‚Äôs window doesn‚Äôt close until March and that means Flamengo hold the cards. It‚Äôs a shame it‚Äôs ended this way, but the club need players who are going to fight and get us out of this mess.

Which of the West Ham players have impressed you most this season and who has been underwhelming?

I‚Äôm clutching a bit here! I think Alphonse Areola has done well, he‚Äôs made some key saves and has kept us in some games, but other times he‚Äôs made some bad mistakes. I don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs had a lot of protection in some games though and some of the saves he‚Äôs pulled off have been outstanding.

I‚Äôve been impressed with Mateus Fernandes too, he‚Äôs a quality player, all-action midfielder who has done well. He needs to work on the defensive side of his game a bit, but there is a player there with a lot of potential. I would probably throw Walker-Peters in there too, every time he‚Äôs featured he‚Äôs been solid. Jean-Clair Todibo has really stepped up under Nuno recently too, he looks like a different player compared to earlier in the season.

In terms of underwhelming, I don‚Äôt think Jarrod Bowen has been in the best of form. You can never question his effort, but he hasn‚Äôt been his usual self and I think he‚Äôs been affected by poor players around him, so hopefully the two strikers can help him and bring that spark back. Crysencio Summerville is another one too, has bags of pace and ability but hasn‚Äôt delivered enough this season and I expected more. He‚Äôs got a few goals recently though so hopefully that will help him to kick on.

Max Kilman has been the worst of the lot, I don‚Äôt like singling players out but he has been at the tip of the iceberg. He just never looks comfortable, gets bullied too easily and makes too many mistakes.

If you were Regis Le Bris, how would you set up to beat West Ham?

The simple answer, spam crosses into the box. West Ham have conceded the most headed goals in the league this season, we are very vulnerable from them and teams clearly target that.

You have good technicians and some very powerful players, so even if we clear the first delivery, the second phase is just as important and I‚Äôm sure RLB will emphasise that to his players. You have Ballard, Alderete, Brobbey who can all cause problems and will most likely look to target our full-backs who aren‚Äôt the strongest aerially.

I know out of possession you have been very adaptable, but I do think we are shaky when teams press us high when we are building from deep. Spurs were quite passive and gave us too much time which allowed us to play through, but I expect Sunderland to be much more compact when they sit off us. I think if you force us long, you are more than capable of winning those duels in the air and then gaining some control, so we have to look to go wide and look to get in-behind rather than play in front of you.

I think Brobbey will be key to your approach, he loves to drop deep and I think if he makes the right runs, engages defenders to pull out that can create space in-behind which we are vulnerable to, so it‚Äôs something we‚Äôve got to manage.

What style of play can Sunderland expect to encounter?

I expect it to be quite a physical game, cagey and maybe a case of one team waiting for the other to make a mistake before the game becomes more open.

I think we will continue in our shape from Spurs, which was a 4-4-2 or 4-4-1-1 in possession, the full-backs will push up high to support the attack, while you might see Summerville drift inside to get the ball and then also mainly stay wide. We will look to play through the thirds, but as I said maybe go long into wider areas and try to stretch your defence that way. I know when teams have settled possession Sunderland like to defend in a 5-4-1 at times and make it very difficult, and I worry without Paqueta we will struggle to break you down and create clear cut chances.

Off the ball, similar shape in a 4-4-2, funnel you wide and then look to lock on and be aggressive. I think we‚Äôll look to start fast and take the game to you, so I think Sunderland will have to manage that.

Are any players missing and who do you think will start?

Paqueta and Fabianski are out, Diouf will hopefully return from AFCON to have a place on the bench. Other than that I‚Äôm expecting the same eleven that started against Spurs.

Areola (GK), Wan-Bissaka, Mavropanos, Todibo, Scarles, Bowen, Soucek, Fernandes, Summerville, Pablo, Taty Castellanos.

It will be Sunderland‚Äôs first visit to the London Stadium ‚Äì what is your prediction for the final score?

I think it‚Äôll be a tight game, quite cagey too. I have been really impressed with Sunderland and it‚Äôs nice to see a team bridge that gap after getting promoted. You had a plan when you came up and have made some really smart signings.

I know you haven‚Äôt had the best of time away from the Stadium of Light, but I think apart from that Brentford result you have been in a lot of games and competed well, so it‚Äôs come down to fine margins and I don‚Äôt think you are far away from getting a win.

My optimistic side is saying a draw, so I‚Äôll go with 1-1.

title: Boston Celtics at Chicago Bulls: Stream, lineups, injury reports, broadcast (1/24)
description: The Celtics ought to come away with a victory if they bring their best to bear, but it is unclear if they will have the legs to do so.
fullText:
The Boston Celtics will make the trip to Illinois to take on the Chicago Bulls in the second game of a back-to-back on this Saturday (Jan. 24) night after gutting out a double-overtime win vs. an Eastern Conference foe in New York City the night before.

The Celtics could be without at least one of the regular starters in the tilt if the injury report remains the same, but exhaustion from the especially long contest on the first half of the back-to-back is a more likely threat to Boston racking up another win. The Celtics ought to come away with a victory if they bring their best to bear, but it is unclear if they will have the legs to do so.

At present, the Celtics have a 28-16 record and a two-game win streak coming into the tilt. That has them second in the Eastern Conference standings.

The Bulls are the owners of a 22-22 record and a three-game win streak, good enough for ninth place in the East.

Boston beat the Brooklyn Nets 130-126 on the road.

Chicago beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 120-115, also on the road.

For the Celtics, no report was available with the game the night before, but in that game, Jayson Tatum (Achilles) was out, as was Josh Minott (ankle) and Derrick White (rest).

For the Bulls, Zach Collins (toe) and Noa Essengue (shoulder) are out.
